revised_title: Rotational Excitation of Carbon Monoxide by Hydrogen Atom Impact: A Quantal Study
tldr: This article presents a quantal study of the rotational excitation of carbon monoxide in collision with hydrogen atoms. The authors construct an interaction potential at short range and use the close-coupling formulation to assess the reliability of the fixed-nuclei approximation. They also examine two simplified close-coupling methods and find that they can provide results of useful accuracy. The study is relevant to understanding the physical conditions in interstellar clouds and the formation of protostars.
